intro: Gynoxys nervosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Mexican velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange and are borne in clusters at the base of the leaves. Gynoxys nervosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
